text: Thomas Brennan was an English footballer who played as an inside forward for Port Vale, Stockport County, and Stafford Rangers. ==Playing career== Brennan joined Port Vale from Cobridge in August 1916. He made his debut at inside- right in a 1–0 defeat to Preston North End in a Football League, Lancashire Regional Section match at Deepdale on 5 January 1918. He was conscripted into the Army, but continued to play for Port Vale when he was in Staffordshire. He left the club in May 1919 and went on to play for Stockport County and Stafford Rangers. ==Statistics== Source: {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !rowspan="2"|Division !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |Stockport County |1919–20||Second Division||1||0||0||0||1||0 |} ==References== Category:Sportspeople from Staffordshire Category:English footballers Category:Association football inside forwards Category:Port Vale F.C. players Category:Stockport County F.C. players Category:Stafford Rangers F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:British Army personnel of World War I
title: Tom Brennan (footballer)
